flow.descriptionCdata:
5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.0838b001-b2a3-4c28-884f-f47d722d7349.description=
Adds a value into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.09d74091-7fc1-4337-9ca6-8f34a8c8992c.description=
Retrieves the next value from the collection.  This collection is populated by the LDAPSearch operation.

Input Parameters\:
DN - The DN parameter used in the LDAPSearch operation.  This becomes the key used to find the result set.

Responses\:
value retrieved - The next value in the collection was retrieved and stored in the returnResult result.
no more values - No more values remain in the collection.
5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.42f756a2-9bc0-4bce-875b-138091acb7c4.prompt=Distinguished Name\: 5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.4605f7a7-a7ba-4824-9e8b-bb7da2582d7e.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.738106f1-cdfd-405f-a917-292202cbf9f9.description=
Checks to see if a string matches a specific rule.

Inputs\:
matchType - The type of match to perform.
toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
matchTo - The string to match against.
ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.

Responses\:
success - The String matched.
failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.7746ed38-3de9-487a-ad90-94b2430e0064.description=
Searches for specific properties in LDAP. Returns a list of the values of the given properties for the first object that passes the filter (given in the corresponding input). The rest of the property values (for the other objects) are stored in a collection that is accessible via the LDAP Search Next Result operation.

Input Parameters\:
host - Name or IP address of LDAP server to query. Can also be used in the form " host\:port".
DN - Base DN for search.
filter - Search filter (see Note section).
propertyNames - Names of properties to return (ex. distinguishedName,telephoneNumber).
username - Name of user to connect to LDAP as.
password - Password of user.
port - Specify the port in case it is not the default one, or it is not specified in the host path.
delimiter - A delimiter to separate the property names in the input and the property values in the result. If no value is assigned the delimiter is set to "," by default.

Responses\:
success - was able to retrieve objects and property values from LDAP. First value returned as returnResult result
failure - either no objects were found, an invalid or duplicate property name was provided or an error occured. See returnResult for more information

Note\:
The filter input can be a simple filter, or a composed one. The filter can be composed by the rules described in "RFC2254 - The String Representation of LDAP Search Filters" which can be found at http\://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2254.html.  

Example of valid filters\:
member\=CN\=User1,CN\=Users,DC\=mydomain,DC\=local
(|(numsubordinates\=1)(entryid\=15))
(&(mobile\=*)(name\=abcd))
(&(objectClass\=Person)(|(sn\=Jensen)(cn\=Babs J*)))
5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.9df3ad5c-458f-4e9a-ab69-12387e75af62.prompt=Enter a value for toMatch 5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.9e9a3e78-5fc6-4c1a-af89-a658daba8899.description=Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers or strings Inputs\: operator - The operation to perform (+ - * ^ / > < \=\= \!\= >\= <\=). value1 - the first value. value2 - the second value. Returns\: The result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true. failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false. 5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.a1aca0f7-f336-48e1-9388-56f0788e0cb9.description=
Searches for specific properties in LDAP. Returns a list of the values of the given properties for the first object that passes the filter (given in the corresponding input). The rest of the property values (for the other objects) are stored in a collection that is accessible via the LDAP Search Next Result operation.

Input Parameters\:
host - Name or IP address of LDAP server to query. Can also be used in the form " host\:port".
DN - Base DN for search.
filter - Search filter (see Note section).
propertyNames - Names of properties to return (ex. distinguishedName,telephoneNumber).
username - Name of user to connect to LDAP as.
password - Password of user.
port - Specify the port in case it is not the default one, or it is not specified in the host path.
delimiter - A delimiter to separate the property names in the input and the property values in the result. If no value is assigned the delimiter is set to "," by default.

Responses\:
success - was able to retrieve objects and property values from LDAP. First value returned as returnResult result
failure - either no objects were found, an invalid or duplicate property name was provided or an error occured. See returnResult for more information

Note\:
The filter input can be a simple filter, or a composed one. The filter can be composed by the rules described in "RFC2254 - The String Representation of LDAP Search Filters" which can be found at http\://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2254.html.  

Example of valid filters\:
member\=CN\=User1,CN\=Users,DC\=mydomain,DC\=local
(|(numsubordinates\=1)(entryid\=15))
(&(mobile\=*)(name\=abcd))
(&(objectClass\=Person)(|(sn\=Jensen)(cn\=Babs J*)))
5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.a6e6ec23-96b0-4ebd-97ea-3d8fc285ed66.prompt=HostName\: 5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.c9207c44-226e-4dd4-8edd-ef99689bc75f.prompt=Enter a value for matchTo 5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.description=
This flow will determine the last login time of a user in Active Directory. Before windows 2003 this information was not persisted between domain controllers, so all domain controller times are checked, and the most recent is taken.

Inputs\:
host - A domain controller to enumerate all domain controllers from.
DN - The Distinguished name of the user to get the last login time of. For example CN\=AUsersCN,CN\=Users,DC\=domain,DC\=com or CN\=AUsersCN,CN\=Users.
baseDN - The base DN of your domain. For example DC\=domain,DC\=com for domain.com
username - username to use for LDAP queries.
password - password to use for LDAP queries.

Responses\:
success - Last Login time obtained.
failure - something went wrong.

Returns\:
The last Login time as a java formatted string.

Results\:
lastLoginTime - The last Login time as a java formatted string.
5595fbbb-8741-4647-945c-1486ed804243.f753da6e-a70b-4b41-a79a-0706c19f53c2.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
flow.name: Get Last Login Time

scriptlet.name: Step Escape Filter Special Chars in Flow Get Last Login Time (110b2447-f009-41a7-9d99-10b80cb9ef1e)
default
